title: As a sexist gamer, I'm offended
body:
The lack of female power fantasy skins as of late is unnerving. Why can't more females have sexualized figures and outfits with badass abilities? There's nothing wrong with showing a little boob while delivering noob pwnage. Heck, the best part is that you're looking great while pwning noobs!

We could also use a few less clothed female champions. Tryndamere is naturally shirtless and there are a number of other very exposed skins for multiple male champions. Why aren't we getting those for women? Caitlyn's Pool Party skin is the only female skin that shows off a lot of skin. We need more of those! (Rek'Sai doesn't count because she's already nude.)

Sexy skins aren't a bad thing. If they legitimately distract our opponents, then our money was well spent!

We could discuss who is actually making those complaints and whether or not said people had any intention to buy the game in the first place, but that's not appropriate for these boards.

So instead, I'll say this:

Most games are fictional stories in a fictional setting. Not everything is meant to be realistic. Some games will focus heavily on realism. Others will not. Some may base themselves on real events. Most games are meant as an escape from the real world and its issues. A game is an entertainment product of escapism before a product meant to make a statement or parallel on real world events. Games that do not respect the previous statement often do worse because they forget their primary purpose as games.

Well mortal kombat for one's purpose is not to sexualize women  and attract an audiance of sexist pricks. And neither does league. They have games for that. Dead or alive paradise for example. 

The league community is already toxic enough. And needs to be turned around. Example, I was fat shamed by the enemy team mates. Like what? These are either kids or adults that do not belong in this community. But thats besides the point. I don't want league to attract a sexist audiance.

MK11 got rightfully slammed for design choices pandering to groups who weren't going to play the game in the first place.

I will say that I am less fond of Kitana's MK11 incarnation compared to her MK9 and MKX iterations. However, my only ill will towards NRS is that the lead developer stated that these changes, largely towards diversifying and covering up the female cast, were intended as a more mature and realistic take.

The realism part was debunked on two counts. The double standard where the males were not similarly covered up was the first big issue on it. There's also the fact that female MMA fights still have the women in little more than a sports bra and booty shorts. If the focus was on fighting for your life realism, why are most of the male variants shirtless to some extent?

There's also the fact they made Kitana more Asian (Skarlet and Jade were given similar treatment as Russian themed and Middle Eastern themed respectively). If not for their prior announcement, I would have had no issue with this change. I would have noticed it and let it fly under the radar. She's also more covered up in this version than ever before when she actually had some of the more conservative outfits. Again, I wouldn't have really cared if NRS had said nothing on "we're aiming to make things more mature".

I personally don't see a huge problem with showing skin in games. That said, there are times it's more appropriate than others. Some games can pull it off, others can't. Mortal Kombat could pull it off reasonably well before and had no reason to downgrade. Call of Duty? Not so much (unless it's suddenly a pool party themed event). Overwatch? Very doable. League? That's half of the fun. 

Now, does it become sexist to show skin? I don't think so. It becomes sexist when utilizing derogatory stereotypes and attempting to reinforce them. That said, I still want my character to look good while doing her badass activities. That usually means making her as visually appealing as possible and that often means exposing some skin. If it's sexist to want to look good, then I will happily keep that title.
